Semester 1: State Core Gen Ed Composition; Writing Requirement (3 credits)
State Core Gen Ed Humanities (3 credits)
Semester 2: State Core Gen Ed Biological or Physical Sciences (3 credits)
State Core Gen Ed Mathematics (3 credits)
Semester 3: Studio electives (Critical Tracking; ART/GRA/PGY prefixes at 2000 level OR DIG 2131C) (CT) (6 credits)
Semester 4: Quest 2 (Gen Ed Physical or Biological Sciences) (3 credits)
Select one 2000-level ARH survey course that focuses on the art of Africa, Asia, and/or Latin America and/or on the art of Native Americans, Aboriginal Australians, and/or Pacific Islanders
Studio electives (Critical Tracking; ART/GRA/PGY prefixes at 2000 level OR DIG 2131C) (CT) (6 credits)
Semester 5: Before beginning 3/4000 studio coursework, students must successfully submit and pass the sophomore portfolio review.
State Core Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Sciences (3 credits)
Studio elective (ART/PGY/GRA prefix at 3/4000 level) (3 credits)
Semester 6: Studio electives (ART/PGY prefix at 3/4000 level) (6 credits)
Semester 7: Studio elective (ART/PGY/GRA prefix at 3/4000 level) (3 credits)
Gen Ed Social and Behavioral Science (3 credits)
Semester 8: Any Gen Ed Humanities, Social and Behavioral Science, Physical Science, or Biological Science (3 credits)
